channel.title: Continued JBE Development
channel.description:
K so I'm using JBE, shit was breaking constantly and what-have-you so I decided to work on it.
So far I think I've fixed all of the bugs and I added searching (with highlighting) in the editor pane.
If anybody wants to help, https://github.com/Contra/CJBE ...or you can just complain about JBE/give me ideas for features in this thread
inb4 people whine about me doing a shit job

item.title: Continued JBE Development
item.dc:creator: @the_bomb_454 the bomb 454
item.description:
@the_bomb_454 wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:18, topic:379831”]Ah Jackie, one of the programs that challenged my FOOS views.

What do you think of having clickable jumps? So you click on a JMP or IFEQ and it takes you to where control would land.[/quote]

I’m actually adding that soon. I have the analysis set up to highlight jumps and their jump points. Since I already have it in html, I could just make each jump point an ID and have each jump’s onclick take you to it’s corresponding ID

Not sure how well that will work from within a JEditorPane though lol

EDIT: NVM this is already available in the bytecode view

Read full topic

item.title: Continued JBE Development
item.dc:creator: @the_bomb_454 the bomb 454
item.description:
@the_bomb_454 wrote:

frank_:

its fun to pretend the work of others is your own

Credits to the original author is about everywhere and it’s called “Continued JBE” for a reason. Any code I’ve used is added to the about dialog and credits page. Basically none of this code is by me, I’m just making small changes/integrating other tools

Read full topic

item.title: Continued JBE Development
item.dc:creator: @the_bomb_454 the bomb 454
item.description:
@the_bomb_454 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:11, topic:379831”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=475673.msg3480417#msg3480417 date=1296073216]

@Spel - I’ll add it but I don’t see the point

Like a bytecode diff. The point would be to see what changed between two versions of the same class. You could use it for runescape updates, for different compiler/optimizer settings and a wide variety of other things as well.
[/quote]Basically that. I’ve been longing for a tool like that, but always been too lazy to do it myself.[/quote]

While I was looking for a utility to help with the control flow analysis (added that pane recently) I remember seeing some tools that do this. I’ll add it to CJBE but it’ll probably be funky to match it up with the current UI system

EDIT: Also added searching w/ highlighting a while ago. Working on a control flow diagram pane now

Read full topic

item.title: Continued JBE Development
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:11, topic:379831”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=475673.msg3480417#msg3480417 date=1296073216]

@Spel - I’ll add it but I don’t see the point

Like a bytecode diff. The point would be to see what changed between two versions of the same class. You could use it for runescape updates, for different compiler/optimizer settings and a wide variety of other things as well.
[/quote]Basically that. I’ve been longing for a tool like that, but always been too lazy to do it myself.[/quote]

Isn’t it as simple as dumping the bytecode to a text file (maybe javap?) and then using diff on it?

Read full topic

item.title: Continued JBE Development
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:379831”][quote author=the bomb 454 link=topic=475673.msg3480376#msg3480376 date=1296069455]
@Spel - I’ll add it but I don’t see the point
[/quote]

Like a bytecode diff. The point would be to see what changed between two versions of the same class. You could use it for runescape updates, for different compiler/optimizer settings and a wide variety of other things as well.[/quote]Basically that. I’ve been longing for a tool like that, but always been too lazy to do it myself.

Read full topic
